rationale: 'critically ill' does not involve a risk-adjective.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: The segment reports statistics and severity in neutral terms. 'critically ill' is not a harm noun for the intensifier rule.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: The verbs 'reported' and 'said' are not Q3 moderate verbs. Contains scale ('21 human infections', 'five last year', 'six dead', 'many... critically ill').
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: The segment is a statement of fact, not a loaded rhetorical question.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: The segment reports human case numbers and deaths in China but lacks explicit calming language.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: 'compared with only five last year' uses minimiser 'only' with scale contrast 'five last year' (compared to 21).
